calculators.title: HAS-BLED Score for Major Bleeding Risk

data.label: Uncontrolled hypertension (Systolic ≥ 160mmHg)
Renal disease (Dialysis, transplant or Creatinine >2.26mg/dL (200µmol/L)
Liver disease (Cirrhosis or bilirubin levels >2x normal with AST/ALT/AP >3x normal)
Stroke history
Prior major bleeding or predisposition to bleeding
Labile INR (Unstable/High INRs, time in therapeutic range <60%)
Alcohol use ≥ 8 drinks/week
Age > 65 yrs
Medication usage that predisposes patient to bleeding (NSAIDs, Antiplatelet agents)

0: Low Risk for major bleeding (~1 in 100 patient years); Anticoagulation should be considered
1: Low Risk for major bleeding (~1 in 100 patient years); Anticoagulation should be considered
2: Moderate Risk for major bleeding (~2 in 100 patient years); Anticoagulation can be considered
3: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
4: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
5: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
6: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
7: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
8: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
9: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered
10: High Risk for major bleeding; Alternatives to anticoagulation should be considered

content: HAS-BLED Score estimates the risk of major bleeding for atrial fibrillation patients to determine whether to start anticoagulation therapy
Scores >5 were too rare to determine risk but the risk of major bleeding is likely >10%
A study comparing HAS-BLED to HEMORR2HAGES and ATRIA showed the HAS-BLED score was superior in assessing risk

Pisters R, Lane DA, Nieuwlaat R, de Vos CB, Crijns HJ, Lip GY. A novel user-friendly score (HAS-BLED) to assess 1-year risk of major bleeding in patients with atrial fibrillation: the Euro Heart Survey. Chest. 2010 Nov;138(5):1093-100. doi: 10.1378/chest.10-0134. Epub 2010 Mar 18.

Lip GY, Frison L, Halperin JL, Lane DA. Comparative validation of a novel risk score for predicting bleeding risk in anticoagulated patients with atrial fibrillation: the HAS-BLED (Hypertension, Abnormal Renal/Liver Function, Stroke, Bleeding History or Predisposition, Labile INR, Elderly, Drugs/Alcohol Concomitantly) score. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2011 Jan 11;57(2):173-80. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2010.09.024. Epub 2010 Nov 24.

calculators.title: Cardiac Risk Index for AAA Surgery (Lee)

data.label: Patient has Coronary artery disease (MI or positive stress test)
History of Congestive Heart Failure
History of Cerebrovascular disease (TIA or stroke)
Patient has diabetes and is on insulin
Chronic renal insufficiency (Creatinine > 2mg/dL or 176.8 µmol/L)

0: Approximate risk of cardiac complication: up to 7%
1: Approximate risk of cardiac complication: up to 7%

content: The index score helps to identify patients at higher risk for cardiac complications post surgery
In the Lee study, patients with 2 risk factors had a paradoxical decrease in cardiac complication rates
Lee TH, Marcantonio ER, Mangione CM, et al. Derivation and prospective validation of a simple index for prediction of cardiac risk of major noncardiac surgery. Circulation. 1999; 100: 1043-9.
